author: potuz
content:
I am trying to raise this internally on prysm without much success but I feel that I will get more traction as time goes by. I want to remove MeV boost support from prysm starting at the Capella fork. Originally I wanted this to be a joint decision from CL teams. Now I donÂ´t really care anymore, it's completely irresponsible to start thinking on hard fork epochs without having tested the path that 95% of our blocks will pass by. I am hoping to raise awareness of this critical situation and I would want the dev community to voice about this. I consider the arguments about forks of official clients completely bogus. The bottom line is this: 

I do not want a piece of software that has my signature (even if in minor parts and a small percentage of actual code)  to be released without having been tested.

author: sproul
content: we _are_ going to test though, especially on Sepolia

author: potuz
content: I've been told so for a few devnets now. If we are testing then I'm happy to stop bugging about this

author: sproul
content:
IMO it's much easier to test on an established network where relays already exist (i.e. Sepolia/Goerli)

For future forks I think we should advocate for _someone_ to test relays on devnets. Who exactly we ask and how we incentivise it is open for discussion. Good candidates could be Flashbots, EF devops, <@539495253418180618> or EthStaker. I know all of these people are already very busy with other things, so it might help if we could pay them for their time

content: I would hope that we can test on zhejiang, so that come sepolia we're testing that the packages produced by the client teams are ready for use rather than still being in the build/debug/rebuild cycle.
